name: Overview
main:
Large scale displacement and humanitarian needs persist in Iraq following the expulsion of Islamic State from Iraqi territory. There are 2.56 million IDPs as a result of IS invasion and military operations. The number of returnees is increasing and over 3.2 million IDPs have returned to their areas of origin since October 2016. Many areas of return lack basic services, livelihood opportunities and still face insecurity due to extremist pockets throughout the country. Forced returns are reported as IDP camp closure continues. IDPs and Syrian refugees make up 25% of the population in the Kurdistan Region of Iraq (KR-I).??

INFORM measures Iraq’s risk of humanitarian crisis and disaster to be very high, at 6.8/10. Hazard and exposure as well as lack of coping capacity are of particular concern, at 7.6/10 and 6.9/10 rates.?
latest_developments_past: 11/02: 2,260 children are in detention in Iraq and half of these are suspected of being used as child soldiers. ?
latest_developments_upcoming: National elections are scheduled to be held in May 2018.
